text:
Ah, my dear fellow!

Porfiry smiles, arms wide, welcoming.  
Raskolnikov sits, eyes sharp and focused.  
Porfiry: “Come, sit down, old man!”  

---  

Tension fills the air, eyes darting.  
Raskolnikov thinks: “He didn’t offer his hand.”  
Porfiry: “I brought you this paper… about the watch.”  

---  

Raskolnikov feels unease creeping in.  
Porfiry: “Yes, yes, it’s all right.”  
Raskolnikov thinks: “Why did I say ‘I believe’?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov feels intense unease and suspicion during his encounter with Porfiry Petrovitch, reflecting his inner turmoil and fear.
